item.description:
After lingering on 19th century novels for months, we now turn to something a little different: a mid 20th century novel set in 1830s against a Caribbean Gothic backdrop. Its most mysterious character is--you guessed it--the madwoman in the attic. In fact, this is the very woman we found so little about in Charlotte Bronte's "Jane Eyre". Interested to hear her side of the story? Join our discussion at the next book meeting.

And if there is overwhelming interest in having a second meeting on "Vanity Fair", please let me know and I will determine if we shall have one in the coming weeks.

Happy reading!

Arlinda

group.name: Classic Books: Book Club for Die-hard Readers

item.name: Next Read: Wide Sargasso Sea by Jean Rhys
